author: archyde
title: Weather, “something changes”. Sottocorona speaks of “heavy precipitation”: where –
text:
“Let’s hope it’s not always like this”: with these words Paolo Sottocorona greeted Omnibus viewers and released the latest weather forecast. What was he referring to? To the “few clouds” and the possibility of new rains that fade away day after day because the heat is getting the better of it. Things are, however, a little better. “Yesterday’s forecast predicted a total absence of precipitation in the Alpine areas. Today, something changes”, he anticipated. In the Alpine area, in fact, “there is the possibility of isolated but significant phenomena in the afternoon hours”, he explained. “Then, there is a small spot in the area of ​​Lake Garda”, he specified.
Instability will also be present tomorrow, “although reduced”. In the Alps “there are many phenomena. Once again, something from Trentino descends towards the plain”. What is happening in the Centre and South? “Needless to say”: the expert was telegraphic. On Thursday, however, “there is a beginning of change”, he warned. In the North-West areas, there are some isolated phenomena. “Strong instability in Trentino Alto Adige, Veneto, Emilia-Romagna”, continued the meteorologist. Precipitation could be “very abundant”. Finally, minimum temperatures are always “high”.
#Weather #Sottocorona #speaks #heavy #precipitation #Tempo
2024-08-01 23:33:57

author: Lia DeGroot and Sandhya Raman, CQ-Roll Call
title: HHS to cut 10,000 jobs, 'streamline' operations | Business | thebrunswicknews.com
text:
WASHINGTON — The Health and Human Services Department is planning dramatic staffing cuts to the agency, with the stated goal of saving taxpayer dollars and streamlining operations, Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced Thursday morning.
The department outlined plans to cut 10,000 jobs, in addition to the about 10,000 employees who left voluntarily earlier this year.

author: Ulysse LLAMAS
title: Travaux d’Artemio-Franchi : la Fiorentina perd son recours face à la municipalité de Florence
text: - Italie - ACF Fiorentina Travaux du stade Artemio-Franchi : la Fio perd son recours face à la municipalité de Florence Artemio-Franchi, [le Ponte Vecchio](https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/patrimoine/premiere-grande-restauration-pour-le-ponte-vecchio-172119)… c’est le grand ménage à Florence. Un gros conflit autour du stade Artemio-Franchi oppose le club de la Fiorentina et la commune de Florence. Les travaux de l’enceinte ont démarré, mais le club avait demandé à la municipalité locale de les suspendre, notamment à cause de la réduction temporaire de la capacité du stade qui va porter préjudice à la Viola pendant les travaux (le club demandait d’ailleurs également des dommages et intérêts). Le tribunal a rejeté la demande ce mercredi, et indique que les travaux du stade vont se poursuivre. L’équipe jouera donc dans un stade de 24 000 places (au lieu de 41 000) cette saison. La tribune Fiesole, où sont réunis les plus fervents supporters de la Fio, sera fermée pendant le chantier. Les aménagements sont prévus jusqu’en 2026. Bref, c’est un peu la zuppa à la grimace. [Non, Moise Kean ne se reconvertira pas dans le foot-fléchettes](https://www.sofoot.com/breves/non-moise-kean-ne-se-reconvertira-pas-dans-le-foot-flechettes) UL

author: Blair Miller
title: Gianforte vetoes Styrofoam food containers phase-out bill
text:
Montana Gov. Greg Gianforte vetoed a bill this week that sought to phase out the use of polystyrene, single-use food containers in the state over the next 4 ½ years.
House Bill 477 would have prohibited restaurants and other food services from using the containers made of polystyrene – better known under its popular brand name Styrofoam – by the start of 2030. Gianforte said the bill amounted to government overreach.
“Montanans don’t take kindly to federal overreach, and I’m proud we’ve consistently stood up against it. As state government, we should be consistent, actively avoiding such overreach here in Montana,” the governor wrote in his letter vetoing the measure. “Our state should remain a sanctuary for freedom and free enterprise, and let high taxes, high spending, and hyper-regulation remain a feature of deep blue, progressive states.”
The polystyrene phase-out under the bill would have started on the first day of 2028, when restaurants would be barred from serving food or drinks in polystyrene containers if they were going to be consumed on site. It would not apply to raw, uncooked meat, eggs or poultry.
By the next Jan. 1, restaurants, food establishments, resorts and hotels would not be to serve food or drinks in such containers or provide them as to-go containers. And by Jan. 1, 2030, no food packager in the state could use polystyrene packaging for any type of prepared food or baked goods.
The bill, sponsored by Rep. Marliyn Marler, a Missoula Democrat, provided exemptions that would allow the use of such containers if a restaurant could prove there was no alternative packaging that could be used or if doing away with Styrofoam would cause them “undue hardship.” Other exemptions include if the foam was to be used for transportation, construction, health or safety.
Explaining the bill to her colleagues throughout its legislative process, Marler said polystyrene has already been proven by researchers and the federal government to be bad for human and environmental health, and that it is bad for Montana’s economy because it is not produced here and can’t be recycled or repurposed.
Many companies, including some in Montana, have already started producing alternative food containers, she said, also offering that Styrofoam could go the way of the seat belt or pull-off beer tabs.
“Did we wait for that to just solve itself or did we pass some laws across the country?” Marler told her House colleagues in March. “Well, guess what? It works.”
Many Republicans who opposed the bill said they already believe polystyrene is being phased out naturally by the free market after years of information showing it is bad for health and the environment. Why put a government-imposed timeline on the phase out, they asked.
After a Senate committee pushed the dates of the phase-out back, the Senate as a whole changed the bill back to its form as it came out of the House, albeit on a narrow 26-24 vote.
Ultimately, despite receiving enough bipartisan support to narrowly pass both chambers, Gianforte had little regard for it. Both in his veto letter and in a video announcing his veto he didn’t want to spend more money for the Department of Environmental Quality to review exception requests or place any more costs on Montana businesses and consumers.
“The state banning Styrofoam is costly government overreach, and like many Montanans, I enjoy a hot coffee in a Styrofoam cup because it keeps it hot,” the governor said as he sipped coffee out of a cup with a veto stamp on it. “And this bill is a hot mess.”

author: @kfvsnews
title: Tornadoes confirmed to have hit southern Illinois during Wednesday’s storms
text: Tornadoes confirmed to have hit southern Illinois during Wednesday’s storms SOUTHERN ILLINOIS (KFVS) - Multiple tornadoes have been confirmed to have hit southern Illinois during severe storms on Wednesday, May 8. According to the [ National Weather Service in Paducah](https://twitter.com/NWSPaducah), at least four tornadoes touched down on Wednesday. Storm survey teams found an EF1 tornado in Cora and Jackson County in southern Illinois. The tornado lasted from 12:01 p.m. to 12:03 p.m. The maximum wind speeds were 108 mph with a path length of 1.25 miles and a width of 100 yards. At this time, there is one reported injury and no reported fatalities. An EF0 tornado was confirmed to be in the Lake of Egypt area in Williamson County. The tornado lasted from 4:04 p.m. to 4:11 p.m. The maximum wind speeds were 80 mph with a path length of 6.61 miles and a width of 25 yards. At this time, there are no reported injuries or fatalities. On the [Jackson/Williamson County line, an EF1 tornado](https://www.kfvs12.com/2024/05/09/damage-near-jackson-williamson-co-line-consistent-with-ef1-tornado-nws-says/) was confirmed. The tornado lasted from 3:10 p.m. to 3:26 p.m. The maximum winds were 90 mph with a path length of 4.58 miles and a width of 50 yards. At this time, there are no reported injuries or fatalities. Storm survey teams also [found an EF1 tornado in Saline County](https://www.kfvs12.com/2024/05/09/parts-saline-county-heavily-damaged-during-severe-storms/). The tornado lasted from 4:13 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. The maximum winds were 95 mph with a path length of 7.83 miles and a width of 150 yards. At this time, no injuries or fatalities were reported. We will continue to update as more information becomes available. Copyright 2024 KFVS. All rights reserved.

author: Théo Boscher
title: Rédoine Faïd demande un allègement de ses conditions de détention à Vendin-le-Vieil - France Bleu
text: Rédoine Faïd demande un allègement de ses conditions de détention à Vendin-le-Vieil De retour à l'établissement pénitentiaire de Vendin-le-Vieil dans le Pas de Calais, le "roi de la belle" doit rester incarcéré jusqu'en 2060. Devant le tribunal administratif de Lille, il a demandé que son accès au parloir soit assoupli. Il doit se rendre dans un parloir avec une vitre intégrale. Le "roi de la belle" est de retour dans le Pas-de-Calais. Rédoine Faïd est à nouveau incarcéré dans la prison de Vendin-le-Vieil, depuis fin novembre et après son procès qui lui a valu [une condamnation à 14 ans de prison fin octobre pour l'évasion en hélicoptère de la prison de Réau (Seine-et-Marne)](https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/faits-divers-justice/redoine-faid-condamne-a-14-ans-de-prison-pour-son-evasion-en-helicoptere-de-la-prison-de-reau-en-2018-6565481). Avec ses autres condamnations notamment pour un braquage à Roclincourt, dans le Pas-de-Calais en 2011 et pour l'évasion de la prison de Loos-Sequedin en 2013, le braqueur de 51 ans ne pourrait pas sortir de prison avant 2060. Devant le tribunal administratif de Lille, jeudi 28 décembre, il a donc demandé un allègement de ses conditions d'accès au parloir. Lui qui vit à l'isolement depuis dix ans. Aucun contact physique depuis des années Il peut se rendre au parloir deux fois par semaine pour voir ses proches, mais dans un parloir hygiaphone où une vitre les sépare entièrement et ils doivent se parler à travers un téléphone. "Rédoine Faïd veut démarrer une nouvelle phase de sa détention", a déclaré son avocate à l'audience. Elle ajoute qu'il n'a "pas serré sa famille dans ses bras depuis des années". "On ne voit pas comment un projet de détention peut-être envisagé dans ces circonstances", ajoute Me Emmanuelle Choppin qui assiste Me Benoit David. Mais le ministère de la Justice n'est pas de cet avis. Il en prend pour preuve les deux évasions du roi de la belle : à l'explosif à Loos-Sequedin en 2013 et en hélicoptère à Réau en 2018. A chaque fois, Rédoine Faïd est passé par le parloir. Selon le directeur de la prison de Vendin-le-Vieil, il n'a en plus pas "montré de repentance par rapport aux faits commis", c'est pourquoi "sa dangerosité reste actuelle". Une dangerosité qui "reste actuelle" Il rappelle que, comme les autres détenus, Rédoine Faïd a droit à une après-midi et une journée entière au parloir par semaine. Il a aussi un téléphone dans sa cellule et il passe un nombre "extrêmement conséquent d'appels", ajoute la représentante du ministère. La présidente constate que les avis médicaux récents ne pointent pas de dégradation de sa santé mentale, à cause du parloir. Mais son avocate, avant la fin des débats, glisse que les médecins se prononcent rarement contre l'isolement d'un détenu. La décision sera rendue ce vendredi. Ma France : quelle école pour demain ? Pédagogie positive, innovations, inclusion, mais aussi drames du harcèlement, sureffectifs ou encore salaire des enseignants… ces sujets qui concernent l’école en France sont au cœur de l’actualité et de l’attention d’une immense majorité de citoyens.

author: Joel Moreno, KOMO News Reporter
title: chevron-right
text: SEATTLE — The shootings, assaults, sex trafficking and other crimes that occur along Seattle’s Aurora Avenue North will be the focus of a community conversation on Thursday night, hosted by Seattle City Councilmember Cathy Moore and other local leaders. While the latest data shows overall crime is down along the corridor, police said some categories continue to show troubling increases. Those areas include shots fired, robberies, auto theft and violent crime. ALSO SEE | [Man shot and killed outside north Seattle gas station](https://komonews.com/news/local/seattle-homicide-man-shot-killed-n-northgate-way-aurora-ave-n-arco-gas-station-ampm-spd-cpr-crime-gun-violence) Moore has been tracking the concerns raised during meetings of the North Precinct Advisory Council. Statistics presented during those meetings show that overall crime in Seattle’s North Precinct is down 12%. However, violent crime has increased 17%, shots fired are up 35% and auto theft has increased 20% compared to the same time period in 2023. ALSO SEE | [Teens plead not guilty in deliberate hit-and-run attacks along Aurora Avenue](https://komonews.com/news-brief-newsletter/teens-charged-hit-and-run-vehicular-assaults-king-county-superior-court-judge-veronica-galvan-arraignment-13-15-year-old-stolen-car-court-documents-seattle-aurora-avenue-graphic-injuries) The most recent crime trends available show there have been 31 shots fired incidents in the North Precinct so far this year, leading to one person being killed and another 10 people wounded. A flashpoint area is around Aurora and North 105th Street, according to police. FROM OCTOBER | ['No sleep for Aurora': North Seattle residents blame drugs, prostitution on rising crime, shootings in neighborhoods](https://komonews.com/news/local/no-sleep-for-aurora-north-seattle-residents-blame-drugs-prostitution-on-rising-crime-and-shootings-in-their-neighborhoods-seattle-police-deparment-wild-west-danger-protection-community-deterrent-patrol) Along with Moore, Seattle police Chief Adrian Diaz, Community Assisted Response and Engagement Chief Amy Smith, Seattle police Captain Lori Aagard, staff from the Seattle Department of Transportation, as well as members of the Aurora Avenue community will be taking part in the discussion. The District 5 public safety forum begins at 7:30 p.m. Thursday at the Bitterlake Community Center, located at North 130th Street and Linden Avenue North.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Delhi BJP Chief Calls for Kejriwal's Resignation After Bail | Politics
text: Delhi BJP Chief Calls for Kejriwal's Resignation After Bail Delhi BJP chief Virendra Sachdeva has called for CM Arvind Kejriwal's resignation following his bail granted by the Supreme Court. Sachdeva accused Kejriwal and AAP of lacking moral character and expressed concerns over the court's serious observations regarding Kejriwal's arrest and the excise policy scam. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 13-09-2024 12:46 IST | Created: 13-09-2024 12:46 IST - Country: - India In a scathing attack on Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) convener and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal following his bail approval by the Supreme Court, Delhi BJP chief Virendra Sachdeva called for Kejriwal's immediate resignation, citing a lack of moral character. 'If he has any morality left, he should resign immediately. Arvind Kejriwal and AAP have no moral character and are far removed from the true essence of 'Satyameva Jayate,'' said Sachdeva. He added that despite the Supreme Court declaring Kejriwal's arrest legal, AAP continues to misinterpret the term 'Satyameva Jayate.' Sachdeva further stated, 'Bail does not equate to acquittal. Arvind Kejriwal has just joined the 'jamanati club'. The court has serious observations about his arrest in the excise policy scam. The legal process is ongoing, and if convicted, Kejriwal and his aides will face punishment.' The Supreme Court granted Kejriwal bail in a corruption case related to the alleged excise policy scam on Friday, asserting that prolonged incarceration would be an unjust deprivation of liberty. The Court had previously reserved its verdict on September 5 after the hearings. Kejriwal, arrested by the ED on March 21, 2024, and later by CBI on June 26, 2024, is under investigation for money laundering linked to irregularities in the now-cancelled Delhi excise policy of 2021-22. (With inputs from agencies.) ALSO READ [SC takes serious objection to Telangana CM Revanth Reddy's remarks on grant of bail to BRS leader K Kavitha in excise policy scam cases.](/article/Newsalert/3067325-sc-takes-serious-objection-to-telangana-cm-revanth-reddys-remarks-on-grant-of-bail-to-brs-leader-k-kavitha-in-excise-polic) [AAP Councillors Challenge MCD Ward Committee Election Timelines](/article/law-order/3067845-aap-councillors-challenge-mcd-ward-committee-election-timelines) [Delhi High Court Rejects AAP Councillors' Pleas to Reschedule MCD Ward Committee Elections](/article/law-order/3068500-delhi-high-court-rejects-aap-councillors-pleas-to-reschedule-mcd-ward-committee-elections) [AAP Condemns BJP's President Rule Call in Delhi, Claims Undermining Democracy](/article/politics/3069346-aap-condemns-bjps-president-rule-call-in-delhi-claims-undermining-democracy) [Delhi Opposition Appeals to President Murmu Over AAP Government Crisis](/article/politics/3069240-delhi-opposition-appeals-to-president-murmu-over-aap-government-crisis)
